pageContext.claim: “We don’t have any tariffs. … We don’t even have tariffs. I’m using tariffs to negotiate. I mean, other than some tariffs on steel -- which is actually small, what do we have? … But I didn’t put tariffs. Where do we have tariffs? We don’t have tariffs anywhere. … We don’t have tariffs. Where do we have tariffs? … There’s no tariffs.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a baffling set of denials. Trump has authorized $305 billion worth of tariffs, on solar cells and modules, washing machines, steel, aluminum. Tariffs on a range of Chinese products alone account for $250 billion.
